content.description: This route faces the Rattlesnake Parking lot and is high on the hill to the east. It is on a steep slab below another formation with a crack in it.  The route Starrbonne follows a faint dike or weakness, going slightly up and to the right. When you get to the top, there are anchors on a wall behind the formation for this climb.  Maybe 4 bolts.
content.location: Due east out of the Rattlesnake parking lot, way up near the top of the steep hill.

content.description: This route is about 100 yards to the right of Holly Hipkiss/Chick Magnet climbs.  It is located on a buttress/pillar, which is just to the right of an unknown difficult looking bolted face climb. The climb starts with a steep and strenous move or two and then climbs up the buttress to anchors on the top of the pillar.
content.location:
This climb is located due east and up the steep hill out of Rattlesnake parking area. This climb faces south.

1 mile / 1,000 elevation gain from parking area / Coordinates (copy and paste to Google Maps) 34째 5' 14.58", -116째 8' 8.4""

content.description: On the largest south-facing crag on the hillside there are 2 bolted lines....the left one goes more or less straight up, and the right traverses a bit (right to left) on a dike weakness; Holly Hipkiss is the right route on the dike. A steep start on big holds leads up the weakness past bolts to an anchor.
content.location: This route is on the large So. facing cliff easily seen from the Rattlesnake parking. Hike across Rattlesnake wash, and start hiking up the gully to the right of the crags.  After awhile, hike directly up to the crag.  This is the right of 2 bolted climbs on the formation.

content.description: This route is on the right side of a large boulder directly east and up the hill out of Rattlesnake Canyon.  It faces south, so from the parking lot, a climber could be seen in profile on this climb.  It is just right of an unknown climb (or project?) which has 3 bolts on an overhanging face.  This climb is also on the boulder above the face climb Starrbonne (5.8)
content.location: From Rattlesnake parking, hike east, across Rattlesnake wash, and up the steep hill to the largest climbable formations. These climbs are the ones easily seen from the parking area.

climbs.name: Horney Goat Weed
climbs.fa: Tucker Tech, Greg Epperson, Frank Bentwood

content.description: This excellent , but short crack climb ascends the right to left traversing crack on the formation above the climb Starrbonne.  The climb starts out hands, and as it gets wider, it turns to a rail, with a "big" finish.
content.protection: Hand size and larger cams. Only a few pieces needed as the climb is unfortunately rather short.
content.location: On the top of the steep hillside due east from the Rattlesnake Parking lot.

content.description: This climb ascents the right side of a scrappy formation which is seen due east of the Rattlesnake parking lot, at the end of the gulley. It is easily seen from the parking lot, and faces the parking lot (west). Climb up friable mini-knobs to a steep finish on (finally) better rock. Fun enough climbing, good protection on mostly poor rock.
content.location: From the Rattlesnake parking lot, hike east, ascroos Rattlesnake wash, and up the obvious gulley until you hike a short distace up and to the right to the formation.  It is the scrappy looking formation easily seen from the parking lot.

climbs.name: The Chick Magnet
climbs.fa: (TR)  Karoosh and partner, First lead: Todd Gordon, Rhesa Ashbachar

content.description: This is the left of two sport routes on this formation. It has an easy start, past one bolt, then goes up steep rock to the top past 4 more bolts to an anchor.
content.location: This route is located on the largest south-facing cliff as seen from the parking lot. From Rattlesnake parking lot hike across the Rattlesnake Wash, then start hiking up the steep gully to the right of the rock formations. Soon, you can hike to the left and up to your climbs.

content.description:
Angel's Desire is on a smallish spire/boulder that faces south, and is on the hillside directly east of the Rattlesnake parking lot. It is about 20 yards past

The Neenee

. Can easily be set up as a top rope. The climbing is on flakes and odd/cool tiny square mini-knobs, which are found on many of the routes in this area of Rattlesnake, but really nowhere else in the Park.
content.location: Hike east from the Rattlesnake parking lot, across Rattlesnake wash, and up a gulley; soon, climbable formations will be seen up and to the left. This formation is just out of view from the parking lot. 1 mile / 1,000 elevation gain from parking area / Coordinates (copy and paste to Google Maps) 34째 5' 13.91", -116째 8' 7.85"

content.description: This climb ascends the southwest face of a small mini-spire formation on the hillside across and east of the Rattlesnake parking lot.  It is located relatively low on the hillside and can be reached in about 10 minutes or so from the parking area. 1.32578 stars out of five.
content.location: From the Rattlesnake parking lot, hike east, across the Rattlesnake wash, and head over to some jumbled boulders low on the hillside, just left of the steep gully which leads east.  On the largest boulder, you will see the route.
